text:
Eimuntas Nekrošius (November 21, 1952 – November 20, 2018) was a Lithuanian theatre director. He was born in Pažobris village, Raseiniai district municipality, Lithuania. His career began in 1979. He worked with the Kaunas State Drama Theatre. A movie actor, Nekrošius was known for his role in "The Corridor". He directed plays such as "Macbeth", "Hamlet", "The Day Lasts More Than a Hundred Years" and "Faust".
On November 20, 2018, one day shy of his 66th birthday, Nekrošius died in Vilnius, Lithuania of a heart attack at the age of 65.

annotations.surface_form: The Day Lasts More Than a Hundred Years
